newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah stable in quiet late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah stable in quiet late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was stable against the dollar in quiet trading on Wednesday, dealers said.

They said operators declined to buy dollars because of some underlying bearish sentiment but they were also reluctant to sell on worries of possible trouble at a court hearing of the opposition party scheduled for Thursday, August 22.
Megawati Sukarnoputri, ousted leader of the opposition Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI), has sued the government and the military for ousting her as party leader.
Spot rupiah was quoted at 2,342.0/42.5 at 0840 GMT against the opening of 2,341.75/42.25.
Dealers said trading was pretty narrow which left little room to make a profit.

They said earlier some operators speculated on a strengthening of the rupiah as the current interest rate differentials would not be affected after the U.S. Federal Reserves held interest rate steady on Tuesday.
They said operators still could break the dollar's resistance at the 2,341.5 level because of the central bank's floor rate which limited further downside.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,341.45/41.75 and 2,341.00/41.65, respectively.
"Operators tried to reduce trading and keep outstanding exposures at a minimum, so that they can reverse positions easily if anything unexpected does happen," one said.
He said operators generally did not expect anything major to happen on Thursday but they remained cautious.

One U.S. bank dealer said some activities were seen in the swap market, with offshore operators seen unloading six-month swap to a low of 107.0 points before it rebounded slightly to 108.0/110.0 points late in the afternoon.
One local bank dealer said some offshore players had some rupiah in excess which they parked in the forward market.
He said speculation on a lower interest rate environment seemed to aide the downtrend partially.
Overnight swap was at 0.45/0.55 and tom/next at 0.50/0.55.
One-month swap was at 17.75/18.50, two-month at 35.0/36.5 and three-month at 55.0/56.5.
Dealers said liquidity supply was relatively ample late in the afternoon, with the call money easing to 9.5 percent from 12.0/13.0 percent in the morning.
The central bank raised its intervention rate by one point to 2,336/2,454 and the conversion rate also by one point to 2,336/2,382 on Wednesday.
